Register now, add these sessions to your agenda, and come with your toughest problems.

entry.title: SAP Ariba Supplier Management & Risk 2511 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
New Transactional Use Cases for Approvals and Navigational Use Cases for AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance (SLP-2288)

This feature adds navigational use cases for viewing supplier data and performing common supplier management activities, and transactional use cases for approvals, in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance with AI copilot Joule. Users can get assistance from Joule for viewing supplier profiles, creating supplier request and modular questionnaire projects, finding out approval status for projects where they're an approver, and finding the projects that are pending their approval.

 
This feature adds the following capabilities in Joule for supplier management:

Use Case Type

Use Case

Description

Example

Transactional

Tasks still pending approval

Displays a list of tasks pending approval by the current user, with options for approving or denying the tasks in Joule. Results include matching tasks in all project types. There's currently no way to filter the list by project type.

Tasks in some supplier management projects also support a Request Additional Info option. You must navigate to the task details page if you want to use this option rather than approving or denying the task.

Show me tasks pending approval

Transactional

Check approval status

Displays the approval status and currently active approvers of the specified task. You must include the task's ID in the question

Check approval status for task TSK1234567

Navigational

View a supplier's profile

Displays the matching supplier or suppliers. Choose Open in App to view the supplier's profile. To find suppliers by ID, you must include the supplier's SM vendor ID in the question.

Show me the profile for supplier 12345678

Show me the profile for supplier ABC

Navigational

Create a supplier request

Displays a Create supplier request in app quick link that opens the supplier request form or questionnaire configured for your site, if you have permission to create supplier requests. The link opens either the standard supplier request or the Dun & Bradstreet-integrated supplier request, depending on which one your organization uses.

Take me to the page for creating a supplier request

Navigational

Send modular questionnaires to suppliers

Displays a Send modular questionnaires in app quick link that opens the first page in the workflow for inviting suppliers to standalone modular questionnaires, if you have permission to create modular questionnaire projects.

Take me to the page for creating a modular questionnaire

View implementation details and more here.

 

Ability to Exclude System Generated Versions during ERP sync Internal and External Registrations (SLP-2310)

This feature ensures a new questionnaire version is only created if ERP sync changes the vendor mapped questions of the current active version, preventing unnecessary versions and maintaining clarity in version tracking in registration questionnaire only. (This feature is applicable only to supplier registration.)

View implementation details and more here.

 

New User Research Panel Link in the User Feedback Survey (SLP-2333)

When users complete the feedback survey, they now see a new user research panel link on the thank you page. The link allows users to sign up for the SAP User Research Panel, where they can engage with SAP and provide product feedback.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Changes to the User Interface

After a user submits a completed feedback survey, the thank you page now includes a SAP User Research Panel link. Choosing the link opens a sign-up form for the panel.

View implementation details and more here.

 

AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk (SRISK-1848)

Joule, SAP's generative AI copilot, is now available in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk. Joule uses a conversational interface to help users complete tasks efficiently. It leverages generative and other AI technologies to understand natural language requests, identify intent, perform actions, and provide insights. Using generative AI, it can execute tasks, deliver tailored responses, and summarize information effectively.

View implementation details and more here.

 

New Country/Region Risk Provider (SRISK-1833)

A new default country/region risk provider, Moody’s Analytics, is available to include up to date country/region risk information in your risk exposure. 

Including the country/region risk as a contributing factor to risk exposure for suppliers allows organizations to make more informed business decisions. The country/region risk exposure is displayed on the SAP Ariba Supplier Risk dashboard and in the supplier 360° profile.

Currently, SAP Ariba Supplier Risk uses country risk score data from the World Economic Forum (WEF) as the default source of information. With this enhancement, Moody’s Analytics becomes the default source of country risk score data.

Moody’s Analytics Country/Region Risk Index compares investment risk across 191 countries, provides a single country risk score, is updated quarterly, and aggregates threats along six risk dimensions:

  1. Macroeconomic risk

  2. Business risk

  3. Financial risk

  4. Social risk

  5. Political risk

  6. Security risk

Changes to the User Interface

  • On the SAP Ariba Supplier Risk dashboard, the Country/Region score (WEF) column in the Your Suppliers section is now changed to Country/Region score (Moody's).

  • On the supplier profile page, the Risk Exposure tab on the Risk menu displays Moody's risk categories.

  • Any other text or link that references the World Economic Forum (WEF) is now replaced with Moody's.

View implementation details and more here.

 
 

SAP Spend Control Tower - Feature highlights

Data Quality Analytics Dashboards (ARBARE-157)

This feature enables you to analyze the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of spend data loaded from source systems into SAP Spend Control Tower in the Data Quality dashboard. 
Examples of the User Interface:
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
View implementation details and more here.
 

Manage Spend Taxonomy Enhancements (ARBTS-215)

This feature includes enhancements that enable you to expand your custom taxonomy by adding new categories, moving categories, and mapping additional UNSPSC codes.
 
You can now add a new custom category to support new products, map it to a unique UNSPSC level 4 code, and validate changes via SAP Spend Control Tower to prevent duplicates. Additionally, you can move custom taxonomy categories, along with their subtrees, to a new parent, which updates roll-ups for display and dashboards without altering item-level classifications or UNSPSC mappings. Unused UNSPSC codes can also be added to any custom leaf node to extend the taxonomy.
 

Changes to the User Interface

The Spend Taxonomy tab on the custom taxonomy page includes the following new buttons:

  • Add Categories

  • Add UNSPSC Mappings

  • Move To

 
 
 
 
 
View implementation details and more here.
 

Multi-Field Search for Invoice Item Categorization (ARBTS-95)

This feature enables you to evaluate and confirm proper invoice line item categorization using the new Invoice Items View on the Review Invoice Items Categorization page, which streamlines identifying items for review and applying consistent categorization.

The Invoice Items View lists aggregated invoice items and provides a multi-functional search to help you find items that need review. You can also save search criteria and apply a saved search to filter invoice items.

Review Invoice Items Categorization - Grouped View 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

View implementation details and more here.

 

Spend Analysis Benchmarks — Company vs Industry Performance (ANALYSIS-1324)

This feature enables you to view a comparative analysis of year-to-date company spend values and the industry averages along with the deviations for various spend categories in the Spend Analysis Benchmarks — Company vs Industry Performance dashboard.

SAP Spend Control Tower uses anonymized historical data to develop benchmarks for supplier spend and category spend. This data is used to create a benchmark report.

The Spend Analysis Benchmarks — Company vs Industry Performance dashboard provides insights into your company’s spend performance. It enables you to:

  • Compare spend performance across your enterprise, for example by company code or location, against the average and best performer within your company.

  • Compare your overall enterprise spend performance to industry peers, including the industry average and top performers in each area.

 

 

 

View implementation details and more here.

 

Stay connected with your community for more insights and updates:

  • Register for the Early Release Series for 2511 release- Multi-registration link and for CIM customers- P2P link 
  • Feature related materials:
    • SAP Ariba Connect - Release Readiness (Customers except CIM)
    • Readiness Community page (For CIM customers)
  • SAP Community for Intelligent Spend Management page
  • SAP Help Portal pages - Procurement  
  • What’s New

entry.title: Joule Skills: Simplifying Employee Data Updates from Chat to Case
entry.content:
🌟 Introduction

In today’s digital workplace, employees expect quick and seamless HR support — whether they’re updating personal details or submitting important requests. SAP Build Joule Skills make this possible by extending SAP Joule, the generative AI copilot, with custom business logic that connects conversational experiences to enterprise systems like SAP SuccessFactors and SAP CX Service Cloud.

This blog explores how Joule Skills transform HR operations by automating co

🤖 What Are SAP Build Joule Skills?

Joule Skills are custom, AI-powered extensions that enable Joule to perform specific actions or respond intelligently within your organization’s SAP landscape. With SAP Build, you can design these skills to handle structured inputs, integrate APIs, and trigger backend processes — all while maintaining a natural, conversational flow.

In short, Joule Skills let you teach Joule new abilities, such as:

  • Updating employee data in SAP SuccessFactors
  • Creating service requests in SAP CX Service Cloud
  • Fetching policy or compliance details from Knowledge Base Articles (KBAs)
  • Guiding users through document uploads and validation

🧠 What It Is

SAP Build Joule Skills let you teach Joule new capabilities — like answering company-specific questions or triggering SAP processes (e.g., updating employee details, checking sales orders, creating service requests, etc.).

Why use Joule skills in HR?

  • Remove manual steps: guide employees with just-in-time guidance and collect exactly the data HR needs.
  • Improve accuracy: structured prompts reduce missing/incorrect data.
  • Bridge chat → case: automatically open service cases and attach metadata and files.
  • Track compliance: add KBA (knowledge base article) checks and required documentation prompts.

💼 HR Use Case: Name Change and Emergency Contact Update

Let’s consider a real-world example.
Employee Jada is getting married and wants to update her last name and emergency contact details in the company HR system.

Here’s how Joule handles it seamlessly:

  1. Employee Interaction:
    Jada opens the HR portal and types,
    “I need to update my last name and emergency contact due to an upcoming marriage.”

  2. Guided Workflow:
    Joule responds with relevant KBA links, explaining required documents and steps.

  3. Data Collection:
    Joule asks for:

  • New last name
  • Emergency contact name and phone number
  • Marriage date
  • Marriage certificate upload

    Joule validates the inputs and triggers backend automation to:

    • Create a service case in SAP CX Service Cloud, ensuring HR teams can track and process the update.
    • Update Jada’s profile in SAP SuccessFactors with her new personal details automatically.
    • Confirmation:
      Joule confirms submission and provides a case reference for tracking.

🧩 Why Joule Skills Matter for HR

  • Reduce manual effort: Employees can initiate updates via chat without filling multiple forms.
  • Ensure accuracy: Structured prompts ensure complete and validated data.
  • Enhance compliance: Automatically check KBAs or policy documents before submission.
  • Improve employee experience: Faster resolutions and transparent status tracking.

Steps: Integrate the Process into a Joule Skill

1. Open the SAP Build Lobby, choose Sales Order Assistant Joule Skill project.

2. Click Create, then Joule Skill.

3.Enter name update_personal_details and description Allows the user to update their last name and emergency contact information due to an upcoming marriage..

4. Click Parameters and configure Skill Inputs and Skill Input as mentioned

6. Choose Add Input three times and enter the following parameters:

Case Creation Skill

Similarly, create Joule skills that can call APIs for SuccessFactors name change and case creation.

6. Choose New Conversation.

A case is automatically created in Service Cloud V2, and simultaneously, the employee’s last name is updated in SAP SuccessFactors through the integrated Joule skill

✅ Conclusion

SAP Build Joule Skills bring intelligence and automation to everyday HR scenarios. By bridging conversational AI with SAP’s core systems, they empower employees to self-serve while ensuring HR teams maintain control, compliance, and efficiency.

In our example, what used to take multiple emails and forms now happens in one smooth interaction — from chat to case creation to record update.
With Joule Skills, organizations can reimagine HR service delivery and bring true AI-driven automation to the heart of employee experience.

entry.title: Solace Agent Mesh 🤖🌐 : Unlocking Scalable + Real-Time Agentic AI for SAP Customers
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community 👋

I would like to share some hands-on experience with the Solace Agent Mesh and how it could improve the way we build intelligent, event-driven applications in SAP landscapes. If you've been exploring agentic AI, SAP Joule, or event-driven architecture (EDA), this is a framework you need to know about!

I will share some more hands-on tutorials soon.
Feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to build with this.

 

🎯What is Solace Agent Mesh?
Solace Agent Mesh is an open-source, event-driven agentic AI framework that enables multiple specialized AI agents to work together seamlessly across your enterprise landscape. Think of it as the nervous system that connects all your intelligent agents, allowing them to communicate, collaborate, and execute complex workflows in real-time.​

I appreciate that it is open source. You can contribute and star ⭐️ their public repository here:
https://github.com/SolaceLabs/solace-agent-mesh

And learn more on their own website: 
https://solace.com/products/agent-mesh/

To start using the community edition, you can run this in your terminal:

mkdir my-sam && cd my-sam
python3 -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate
pip3 install solace-agent-mesh
sam init --gui
sam run

then go to localhost:8000 to configure the agents and chat with the orchestrator!


Here's what makes it special for SAP customers:

✅ Event-Driven Foundation – Built on Solace+SAP Advanced Event Mesh, which SAP has partnered with for years to power SAP Event Mesh capabilities​

✅ Enterprise-Grade Security – Fine-grained access control, delegated permissions, and governance that meets SAP's security standards​

✅ Real-Time Intelligence – Agents react to live business events from SAP S/4HANA, Ariba, SuccessFactors, any third party and more​. This extends way beyond database updates; it can include camera video feeds 📹, IOT 🛜, phone calls 📳, and much more.

✅ Horizontal Scalability – Asynchronous, decoupled architecture that scales with your business​. Agentic AI can truly scale in size and ambition; a network effect appears.

✅ Multi-Agent Orchestration – Intelligent orchestrator that breaks down complex tasks and delegates them to your specialized agents​: github agents do what they do best, salesforce does what they do best, and SAP Joule Agents excel all around your ERP!

 

💡Why SAP Customers Should Care
As SAP professionals, we're living in an exciting time where agentic AI is transforming enterprise operations. SAP Joule is already showing us what's possible with AI agents in finance, procurement, supply chain, and HR. But here's the challenge: How do you connect these agents to real-time data across your entire IT landscape?​

This is where Solace Agent Mesh becomes invaluable:

🔗 Seamless SAP Integration – Direct integration with SAP S/4HANA via SAP Integration Suite, enabling real-time event consumption from your SAP systems​

⚡ Event-Driven by Design – Leverages SAP's event-driven architecture principles, working perfectly with SAP Event Mesh and SAP BTP​

🤖 Complements SAP Joule – While Joule provides AI copilot capabilities within SAP applications, Solace Agent Mesh extends agentic intelligence across your entire multi-system landscape​

🌐 Hybrid Cloud Ready – Works across on-premise SAP ECC, S/4HANA Cloud, and third-party applications like Salesforce, Oracle, and custom systems​

 

🎬Real-World Scenario: Intelligent Request for Quote (RFQ) Processing
Let me walk you through a powerful use case that showcases the magic of combining Solace Agent Mesh with SAP systems: Automated, Multi-System RFQ Processing.

The Business Challenge 🤔
Imagine you're a manufacturing company. A customer submits an RFQ by mail for 10,000 custom electronic components. To respond with an accurate, competitive quote, your team needs to:

Understand customer requirements (from Salesforce CRM)

Check product specifications (from SAP S/4HANA Product Catalog)

Verify current inventory (from SAP S/4HANA MM)

Assess production capacity (from real-time manufacturing systems/IoT)

Evaluate supplier pricing (from SAP Ariba)

Calculate optimal pricing (considering market conditions, customer history, margins)

Generate compliant quote (meeting regulatory and business rules)

Traditionally, this takes 3-5 days with multiple people manually gathering data from different systems, countless emails, and spreadsheet gymnastics 📊😅. With Solace Agent Mesh, this can happen in seconds ⚡.

The Solution Architecture 🏗️
Here's how an event-driven multi-agent system would work:

1 - An incoming message of any nature becomes an event

2 - The Solace Orchestrator understands the situation and dispatches work to various other agents.

3 - Those agents are called through A2A, communication happens through events, topics, etc.

4 - The human sales team can oversee this process, and approve or modify the final quote.

5 - A high-quality, real-time answer can be quickly provided to the customer!

The Agent Team 🤖🤝
Let's meet the specialized agents working together:

1️⃣ Customer Intelligence Agent (Salesforce Integration)
Skills: Retrieves customer history, preferences, contract terms from Salesforce

Data: Past orders, payment history, negotiated discounts, relationship tier

Value: Ensures pricing aligns with customer agreements and maximizes conversion

2️⃣ Product Catalog Agent (SAP S/4HANA Integration)
Skills: Validates product codes, retrieves specifications, BOM data

Data: Technical specs, material master data, alternative products

Value: Ensures technical feasibility and suggests alternatives if needed​

3️⃣ Inventory Agent (SAP S/4HANA MM)
Skills: Real-time inventory checks, lead time calculations

Data: Current stock levels, reserved quantities, warehouse locations

Value: Provides accurate delivery timelines​

4️⃣ Production Capacity Agent (Manufacturing Systems/MES)
Skills: Analyzes real-time production schedules and machine availability

Data: Current production runs, machine uptime, capacity forecasts

Value: Validates if order can be fulfilled in requested timeframe​

5️⃣ Supplier Evaluation Agent (SAP Ariba)
Skills: Assesses supplier pricing, quality ratings, delivery performance

Data: Supplier catalogs, negotiated rates, risk scores

Value: Optimizes make-vs-buy decisions and supplier selection​

6️⃣ Pricing Optimization Agent (Multi-Source)
Skills: Calculates optimal pricing considering costs, margins, competition

Data: Raw material costs, labor rates, overhead, market pricing, customer willingness-to-pay

Value: Maximizes profitability while remaining competitive​

7️⃣ Quote Generation Agent (Orchestrator)
Skills: Aggregates all inputs, applies business rules, generates formatted quote

Data: Compiled data from all agents, compliance requirements, approval thresholds

Value: Produces compliant, accurate quote ready for customer delivery​


Why This Architecture Wins 🏆
🚀Speed: What took 3-5 days now takes minutes

✅Accuracy: Real-time data from source systems eliminates manual errors and outdated information​

💰Cost Efficiency: Agents manage data intelligently; only relevant information sent to LLMs, reducing token costs​

🔒Security: Fine-grained access control ensures agents only access data they're authorized for​

📈Scalability: Handle thousands of RFQs simultaneously without adding headcount​

🔄Adaptability: Add new agents (e.g., sustainability scoring, compliance checking) without disrupting existing workflows​

🌐Multi-System: Seamlessly orchestrates SAP, Salesforce, manufacturing systems, and external data sources​

 

🔧Technical Integration with SAP
For the SAP technical integration, here's how you'd integrate this:

SAP S/4HANA Integration

# Example SAC configuration for SAP S/4HANA agent agent: name: "ProductCatalogAgent" type: "adk" connections: - name: "S4HANA_Connection" type: "odata" url: "${S4HANA_ODATA_URL}" auth: type: "oauth2" token_url: "${S4HANA_TOKEN_URL}" tools: - name: "GetProductDetails" description: "Retrieve product specifications from SAP S/4HANA" api_endpoint: "/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_PRODUCT_SRV"


SAP Event Mesh Integration

# Event Mesh configuration for event-driven triggers event_broker: type: "solace" connection: host: "${SAP_EVENT_MESH_HOST}" vpn: "${SAP_EVENT_MESH_VPN}" auth: type: "oauth" subscriptions: - topic: "sap/s4hana/product/changed" - topic: "sap/ariba/supplier/updated" - topic: "salesforce/opportunity/created"

SAP Integration Suite Connection
You can use the Solace Micro-Integration for SAP Integration Suite to connect your agents to SAP Event Mesh. This allows:​
- Consuming events from SAP S/4HANA business events​
- Publishing agent results back to SAP systems​
- Supporting both guaranteed (persistent) and direct messaging​

 

🎯Benefits Beyond RFQ Processing
The Solace Agent Mesh architecture isn't limited to RFQs. SAP customers can apply this pattern to:

📦 Supply Chain Orchestration – Agents monitor inventory levels, predict stockouts, automatically trigger purchase requisitions in SAP Ariba​

💰 Accounts Payable Automation – Invoice matching agents reconcile POs, goods receipts, and invoices across SAP FI, SAP MM, and supplier portals​

🏭 Predictive Maintenance – IoT agents detect equipment anomalies, automatically create maintenance orders in SAP S/4HANA, schedule technicians from SuccessFactors​

👥 Employee Onboarding – HR agents coordinate document collection, account creation, training schedules across SuccessFactors, Active Directory, and learning systems​

🛒 Order-to-Cash Optimization – Sales agents validate orders against contracts, check credit limits, optimize delivery schedules across SAP SD, SAP FI, and logistics systems​

 

🚀Getting Started
Ready to explore Solace Agent Mesh for your SAP landscape? Here's how to begin:

1️⃣ Start Small – Pick one high-volume, repetitive process (like RFQ or invoice matching) that involves SAP and non-SAP. systems

2️⃣ Identify Your Agents – Map out which systems need to be queried and what data is needed

3️⃣ Set Up Event Mesh – Configure SAP Event Mesh or Solace PubSub+ to connect your systems​

4️⃣ Build Your First Agent – Use the Solace Agent Mesh framework to create a simple agent that queries SAP S/4HANA​

5️⃣ Add Orchestration – Deploy the orchestrator to coordinate multiple agents​

6️⃣ Scale Gradually – Add more agents and complexity as you gain confidence

 

Resources 📚
Solace Agent Mesh GitHub: github.com/SolaceLabs/solace-agent-mesh​

SAP Integration Suite Documentation: Connect SAP systems to Solace Event Mesh​

Solace Codelabs: Getting started tutorials​

SAP BTP Event-Driven Architecture Reference: Best practices for EDA on SAP BTP​

 

🎬Conclusion
The future of SAP is event-driven and agentic 🤖⚡.


By combining SAP's powerful business applications with Solace Agent Mesh's intelligent orchestration, we can build systems that:

- React in real-time to business events

- Make intelligent decisions across multiple systems

- Scale effortlessly as your business grows

- Maintain enterprise-grade security and governance

Whether you're working with SAP S/4HANA, SAP Ariba, SAP SuccessFactors, or integrating with Salesforce, Oracle, and custom systems, Solace Agent Mesh provides the event-driven backbone to make your agentic AI vision a reality.

I'd love to hear your thoughts! Have you experimented with event-driven architectures or agentic AI in your SAP landscape? What use cases are you most excited about?

Happy coding, and may your events always flow smoothly! 🚀✨

entry.title: What’s new with SAP Business AI, Joule, and Joule Agents in the SAP SuccessFactors 2H 2025 release
entry.content:
SAP SuccessFactors’ second half 2025 release represents a major leap forward for AI capabilities across our HCM solutions, beginning with the introduction of our first of many planned AI agents. These agents, led by SAP’s copilot, Joule, mark a pivotal shift in how HR leaders will use artificial intelligence to create more responsive, efficient, and human-centered workplaces. Let’s look at our new AI agent and some other key AI-related highlights in the 2H 2025 release.

Empowering Managers with the Performance and Goals Agent

The newly available Performance and Goals Agent helps managers lead more meaningful performance conversations. By automatically gathering relevant data, from goals and achievements to feedback, Joule delivers personalized discussion points and suggests follow-up actions like scheduling one-on-one meetings or updating goals. This elevates coaching from administrative to strategic, enabling truly continuous performance management. If you want to learn more about the AI agents for HCM announced recently at SAP Connect, please visit this page.

 Joule Integration with Microsoft 365 Copilot

Through its integration with Microsoft 365 Copilot, Joule now connects data and workflows from Teams, Outlook, OneDrive, and SharePoint directly within SAP SuccessFactors. This unified experience reduces the need to switch between systems, letting users complete tasks, retrieve insights, and make decisions directly in the flow of work.

Smarter Pay Transparency with Explain Pay

Employee Central Payroll users in Germany, Mexico, and Brazil can now access the Explain Pay feature in Joule. The capability provides natural-language explanations for pay-related questions, cutting resolution time by up to 50%. This delivers the transparency and trust employees increasingly expect while decreasing HR support load.

Expanding Generative AI Access and Joule Actions

SAP has expanded generative AI availability to private-sector customers in Saudi Arabia, offering AI-assisted writing and goal-setting across HR workflows. The update also broadens Joule Actions, allowing users to upload files, view employer information, access extended time-off data, and create half-day leave requests, all via conversational prompts.

Learn More

In short, the 2H 2025 release of SAP SuccessFactors strengthens the platform’s role as an intelligent, interconnected HR ecosystem that drives productivity, trust, and engagement, all powered by Joule and SAP Business AI. You can discover more 2H 2025 innovations across the suite by checking out the release highlights brochure, overview video featuring Bianka Woelke, and much more on the Product Release & Road Map Information page.

Together, these innovations demonstrate SAP’s vision for an HR future where AI doesn’t just support processes, it redefines them. By embedding agentic intelligence throughout SuccessFactors, SAP gives HR leaders the tools to transform data into action, decisions into impact, and every moment at work into a more connected, individualized experience.

entry.title: Building Trust in AI: SAP Business AI earns ISO/IEC 42001 Certification
entry.content:
Artificial intelligence is reshaping how businesses operate, innovate, and serve their customers. But as AI becomes more deeply embedded into enterprise systems, ensuring that it behaves responsibly is just as important as making it powerful. 

That’s why we’re proud to share that SAP Business AI has achieved ISO/IEC 42001:2023 certification — the world’s first international standard for Artificial Intelligence Management Systems (AIMS). 
This certification covers Joule, SAP AI Core, and SAP AI Launchpad, reinforcing SAP’s long-standing commitment to building trustworthy, transparent, and ethical AI across our products and services. 

Why This Matters 

Responsible AI isn’t just a principle. It’s a prerequisite for scaling AI safely in enterprise environments. The ISO/IEC 42001 standard provides a structured framework that guides how organizations manage AI across strategy, governance, data, compliance, and sustainability. 

For SAP, this certification validates that our approach to AI meets globally recognized standards for fairness, accountability, reliability, and security. It means our customers and partners can rely on SAP AI solutions that are developed, deployed, and maintained with integrity. 

What the Certification Covers 

The certification recognizes SAP’s efforts to embed responsible AI practices throughout the entire AI lifecycle: 

  • Establishing a comprehensive AI Management System (AIMS) aligned with ISO 42001. 
  • Integrating AI security, ethics, and compliance controls at every stage of AI development. 
  • Enabling cross-functional collaboration among engineering, legal, governance, and compliance teams. 
  • Successfully passing an independent third-party audit that assessed SAP’s operational excellence in AI governance. 

The certification scope includes Joule, SAP AI Core, and SAP AI Launchpad, along with SAP’s internal IT processes and AI governance policies. 

Responsible AI in Practice 

The ISO 42001 certification underscores that SAP Business AI is built on the foundation of responsible AI. 
In practice, this means: 

  • Fairness and Transparency: AI results are explainable, unbiased, and clearly communicated to end users. 
  • Reliability and Security: AI models are developed and deployed with robust safeguards around data use, access, and protection. 
  • Ethical Alignment: Every AI solution undergoes an ethics evaluation to ensure consistency with SAP’s sustainability and compliance goals. 
  • Continuous Adaptability: Governance and risk management evolve as new technologies and regulations emerge. 

Benefits for Our Ecosystem 

For customers and partners, this milestone brings clear advantages: 

  • Confidence that SAP AI systems are developed and managed under a certified, globally recognized framework. 
  • Reduced compliance burden through alignment with international and regional AI regulations. 
  • Stronger data integrity and security safeguards that protect sensitive business information. 
  • The ability to demonstrate responsible AI usage within their own operations and industries. 

Even for SAP teams, the ISO 42001 certification is more than a badge of compliance. It has been a powerful catalyst for collaboration. It’s brought together experts in technology, policy, and compliance to strengthen how we design, test, and deliver AI. This shared framework helps us innovate faster and smarter, with accountability built into every step. 

A Step Toward the Future 

The ISO/IEC 42001:2023 certification is a key milestone in SAP’s ongoing commitment to responsible AI and customer success. It strengthens the foundation we’ve built to ensure every advancement in SAP Business AI delivers innovation with integrity. 

As AI evolves, so will SAP’s dedication to keeping it reliable, transparent, and aligned with our customers’ trust and business goals. 

Learn more about SAP Business AI and how we’re shaping the future of responsible enterprise AI.
